unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Gears Up for Accelerated 5G Rollout Across India**
normalised: **Telecom Sector Gears Up for Accelerated five G Rollout Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has announced a renewed push to accelerate 5G deployment across the nation, targeting enhanced connectivity in both urban and rural areas. Leading telecom operators, including Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio, are poised to expand their 5G networks significantly over the next fiscal year.
normalised: New Delhi, India – The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) has announced a renewed push to accelerate five G deployment across the nation, targeting enhanced connectivity in both urban and rural areas. Leading telecom operators, including Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio, are poised to expand their five G networks significantly over the next fiscal year.

unnormalised: This initiative follows successful trials in cities like Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata and aims to bring high-speed internet access to underserved regions. The rollout plan includes the establishment of thousands of new 5G towers, with an estimated investment of Rs. 30,000 crore.
normalised: This initiative follows successful trials in cities like Mumbai, Delhi, and Kolkata and aims to bring high-speed internet access to underserved regions. The rollout plan includes the establishment of thousands of new five G towers, with an estimated investment of rupee thirty billion.

unnormalised: "We are committed to ensuring that 5G reaches every corner of India by 2025," stated Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw during a press briefing held at Sanchar Bhawan on 10/10/2024 at 11:00 hrs. The Minister emphasized the potential of 5G to revolutionize sectors such as agriculture, healthcare, and education, echoing the "Digital India" vision. Furthermore, the government is expected to announce new spectrum auctions by 15/01/2025. A meeting regarding rollout challenges is scheduled for 20/12/2024 with representatives from various telecom circles. This enhanced infrastructure will facilitate faster data speeds and lower latency, benefiting millions of Indian consumers and businesses.
normalised: "We are committed to ensuring that five G reaches every corner of India by two thousand and twenty five," stated Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw during a press briefing held at Sanchar Bhawan on tenth october two thousand and twenty four at eleven zero zero hours. The Minister emphasized the potential of five G to revolutionize sectors such as agriculture, healthcare, and education, echoing the "Digital India" vision. Furthermore, the government is expected to announce new spectrum auctions by fifteenth january two thousand and twenty five. A meeting regarding rollout challenges is scheduled for twentieth december two thousand and twenty four with representatives from various telecom circles. This enhanced infrastructure will facilitate faster data speeds and lower latency, benefiting millions of Indian consumers and businesses.
